body.name: The Icy Duke Claims a Bride: A Historical Regency Romance Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars From Strangers to True Lovers !
reviews.reviewText: A Betrothal set in motion by two Grandfathers that promised that their Grandchildren yet to be born would wed and unite the Families ! Never thinking about it again the document was shoved into a drawer almost 25 years later. Now the Duke at the age of 30 needs a Wife ! The problem is he is a Recluse . Scarred from in a horrible fire leaving his face disfigured. Afraid to leave his home and socialize amongst the Ton for the horrible things they say about him. The Dowager Dutchess his Grandmother finds the paper and tells him to go Collect His Bride ! The Lady in Question, Is a Spinster ! She wants Nothing to do with Marriage ! She has her own Emotional Scarring. Together they begin a Journey. Certainly not easy. Filled with Mysteries, Plotting, Corruption , Poisoning , and a Surprise who is behind all the Evil !Catherine Wright was the eldest daughter to the Viscount of Sedgehall . She did not want to marry and had turned down many offers. Her sister had become of age and her Father wanted them both married off. The problem was She Didn’t Trust Men !Hugh Vaughan the Duke of Redbridge was being pressured by his Grandmother to marry. He needed an Heir. With never leaving the house to socialize this was a difficult problem. She came up with the idea to use the document she found. This was still difficult, because he had to go out and meet her and sell her family on the idea.Catherine and Hugh meet when he shows up to Collect his Bride ! How do you think that went ? The Father was very agreeable. Not Catherine by any means ! They talk an agreement is made , the wedding happens, and two strangers begin a marriage.Watching this Couple Grow Together is Delightful, Endearing, Captivating ! A Beautiful Story of Love Healing and Blossoming right into your Heart !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Catherine and Hugh
reviews.reviewText: Hugh was known as the cursed masked duke among the ton, and Catherine, as a spinster on the shelf. Expecting Catherine’s family to fulfill a contract signed from 25 years ago, Hugh offers Catherine a marriage proposal. The story focuses on their developing relationship and marriage, while they investigate a mystery, and figure out who is trying to kill them. This is a wonderful, somewhat steamy story, with very appealing characters, each carrying their past baggage hindering their relationship progress, and a dramatic mystery woven throughout keeping the reader’s attention. The plot explores the emotions of first impressions, unshakable judgmental beliefs, and uncompromising assumptions. The author’s brilliant writing abilities does a great job at plot building, encourages the reader to care about the primary characters and empathize with the hurdles they face, and support their future path. A great read. I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The hero has scars that have kept him in seclusion. His grandmother wants him to wed and finds documents between two grandfathers which ends up being a marriage contract. He sets out to claim his bride. The heroine doesn’t want to marry, but will honor the contract so her sister doesn’t have to. Then the story revolves around them coming to terms with their marriage, getting to know one another, and tearing down some walls they both had constructed. There is a villain to add some intrigue. It was a well written story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars always be sure to look under the cover.. or mask
reviews.reviewText: Violet did a wonderful job of making us love and watch the growth of Hugh and Catherine. Not once did Catherine need Hugh to wear his mask. Violet wrote lovingly about both of their scars, his physical and mental, hers mental. They were able to grow to trust and talk with each other and come out on top. The villanous Georgina was a good throw in, and the puppies were a wonderful addition! That instigated a good relationship with Hugh and Catherine.. Thank you for a wonderful depictive read, am glad that even though what transpired about Catherine's mental scars was not listed during the writing, it very much came through, coming to a good end, and a better familial future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The icy duke claims a bride
reviews.reviewText: This is a great read and loved the characters Hugh and Catherine. Hugh has been a recluse ever since he lost his family in a tragic accident. But he has a duty to the Dukedom and find a wife. When his Grandmother hands him an agreement between his Grandfather and his best friend Hugh realizes his search for a bride is simple. That is until he meets Catherine who is headstrong and does not want to marry but she will do anything to protect her sister. But Hugh and Catherine will soon find there is evil around them they will have to overcome before they have a happy ever after..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars All Men Are Unfaithful, Or Are They?
reviews.reviewText: I loved this unbelievable love story. I don’t usually read books with almost 400 pages. I’m an impatient reader and want to finish. This one caught my attention immediately and i almost never wanted it to end. The Cursed Duke is a belated champion with courage and fortitude. Each one of the characters stepped off the pages. Especially the “poor cursed Duke”. When he finally steps up to the plate, he’s my kind of Hero with courage and fortitude. The complicated history and how this story turns is filled with intrigue and may blow your mind. As i said i loved it and highly recommend it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Can he melt?
reviews.reviewText: A good story of two people who marry for different reasons yet find their own hea. This author adds mystery and an unexpected ending to the story. Great characters, strong and determined who are not perfect but so well suited that they truly were made to be together.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Marriage Changes Ideas
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed reading about how a couple who were both affected by traumatic events in their families could grow stronger due to the love and support of their spouses.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this story. Catherine is a spinster and thought she would not marry. Duke Hugh had been injured in a fire and hid himself away from society due to his burns. His family was killed in the fire and he inherited the Dukedom at ten years of age. His uncle had always supported his training as a Duke and taught him his responsibilities. Hugh knew he needed to marry. When his grandmother showed him a contract between his father and his friend, he knew his search for a bride was over. The contract agreed that Hugh should marry one of Lord Sedgehall's daughters. Hugh chose Catherine. They married in a quiet ceremony and they soon have feelings for each other. At times it is quite steamy at times.Events happen that threaten Hugh and Catherine? Who is responsible? Who would stand to gain if anything happens to either of them?Will Hugh be able to solve the puzzle and keep Catherine safe? Read on and enjoy.

reviews.reviewTitle: I see you two now also
reviews.reviewText: As a big Violet Hamers fan I am pleased for the relationship development of these two characters, both equally deserving of a happier ever after both waiting a little bit longer. Define to happiness. Great work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Hugh and Catherine have an arranged marriage but also an instant attraction from the moment they meet. The past for each of them must come to light before they get their HEA. I recommend this book.
